properties.Name: Wien Museum Karlsplatz
properties.description: The museum is located on the Karlsplatz with its famous St. Charles church from the baroque architect Johann Bernhard Fischer von Erlach. The museum offers a mixture of art and history on three floors, from the Neolithic Age to the mid-twentieth century. Historical highlights of the collection are the archaeological finds from the Roman legionary camp of Vindobona, outstanding sculptures from St. Stephen's Cathedral, Weapons from Vienna’s Civilian Arsenal and historical city maps.
properties.openinghours:
Opening hours:

Tu - Su & public holidays: 10:00 - 18:00

Closed: 1 jan, 1 may, 25 dec

Admission fee: 10€ per adult

properties.Name: Stephansdom
properties.description: St. Stephen's Cathedral is the symbol of Vienna. The gothic building has been constructed during the 12th century. The Cathedral is 107.2 meters long and 34.2 meters wide. It has four towers. The tallest tower (south) is 136.44 meters. You can walk up the tower room via 242 steps, from which there is a gigantic view across Vienna. In total the cathedral has 13 bells, the best-known bell of St. Stephen's Cathedral is the Pummerin and is located in the 68.3 meter-tall north tower. It is the second-biggest free-swinging chimed church bell in Europe.

properties.Name: Schatzkammer Museum
properties.description: The Secular Treasury offers a unique panorama covering over a millennium of European history. This is the home of the most important collection of medieval royal objects: the insignia and jewels of the Holy Roman Empire, including the Imperial Crown and the Holy Lance. Further highlights include the Crown of Emperor Rudolf II. Secondly, the Ecclesiastical Treasury offers a fascinating journey through the history of art, piety and religion. The items reach from the medieval cult of relics to the Habsburgs era.
properties.openinghours:
Opening hours:

Daily except Tuesday: 9:00 - 17:30

Admission fee: ~12€ per adult

properties.Name: Spanische Hofreitschule (spanish horse riding school)
properties.description: The Spanish Riding School and its world-famous Lipizzaners offers the highest standard of horse-riding art in the Baroque ambience of the Imperial Palace.The Spanish Riding School in Vienna is the only institution in the world where the classic equestrian skills (haute école) has been preserved and is still practiced in its original form. Many years of training fuse horse and rider into an inseparable unit. The audience is treated to an unforgettable experience by the precision of movement of the Lipizzan horses in perfect harmony with the music.

properties.Name: Wiener Staatsoper (opera house)
properties.description: The Wiener Staatsoper is one of the leading opera houses in the world, built in 1869. Its present is alive with richly varied performances and events. Each season, the schedule features 350 performances of more than 60 different operas and ballets. Once a year, Wiener Staatsoper turns into the world’s most beautiful and elegant ball room for the Vienna Opera Ball: a glamorous gala of unique splendour and allure, the ball of all balls, much-copied around the world.
